passages.text: August 29, 2025 01:00 PM GMT

- Performance: GLL stocks were \(+5\%\) past 2 wks (S&P 500 \(+1\%\) ) as lower rates have seen a pivot back to cyclicals and China. RCL/WYNN/PENN best, CHH/WH/PII worst.- Key Debate: Ahead of NFL kickoff we review share shifts to set the starting line and also examine changes to promotions & advertising.- 2 wks behind: VIK Earnings, Jackson Hole / Dovish Fed talk, Fanduel / CME Group IV, RCL Star debut, Back-to-school began for much of the country.- 2 wks fwd: CT/NYC/Boston Marketing (joining European colleagues Jamie Rollo & Ed Young), Hyatt Mgmt Breakfast, Vegas Field Trip.- Investor Sentiment: Channeling inner Jonathan Groff/King George III from Hamilton... "What comes next?" as rate cuts weighed vs. anticipated tariff pass-through
Exhibit 1: OSB handle share is still skewed to FanDuel + DraftKings, but Fanatics has taken share - albeit largely from CZR/ESPN Bet (+FanDuel modestly)
Note: Only includes states where DKNG/Fanatics/FanDuel all have market access and operator level data Source: State data, Morgan Stanley Research
Exhibit 2: Fanatics is gaining similar share on a GGR basis, but seemingly more directly from FanDuel which could reflect already best in-class hold
Note: Only includes states where DKNG/Fanatics/FanDuel all have market access and operator level data Source: State data, Morgan Stanley Research
North America Industry View

**Exhibit 3:** Hold rates have continued to grind higher y/y across the board, with smaller operators seeing the most significant improvement y/y but FanDuel remaining well ahead of the its peers
Note: Only includes states where we have market access and operator level data
Source: State data, Morgan Stanley Research
Exhibit 4: While Fanduel's already best in-class hold, it has limited GGR gains as peers have gained ground over the past year
Note: Only includes states where we have market access and operator level data
Source: State data, Morgan Stanley Research
Exhibit 5: Market share has been correlated to advertising spend (BetMGM the primary outlier), but all are rationalizing spend yoy YTD...
Note: All advertising data is for 1H in each respective year Source: MediaRadar, Morgan Stanley Research
Exhibit 6: ... but we are seeing new user promo offerings for the NFL season slightly up yoy for the market leaders and Fanatics who pass into first operators continue to scale back.

Operator2025 Promos (Aug 19-26)1 Year 1.5%Y/Y changeDraftKings (DKNG)$300 in bonus bets with $5 wager + $200+ off NFL Sunday Ticket for new users.$200+ $250 in bonus bets offers; some plan to flip + Premium add-on rather than Sunday TicketRicher bundle with higher headline bonus; NFL + shift to Sunday Ticket discountFanDuel (FLUT)Bet $5, get $300 in bonus bets if your first bet winsBet $5, get $200 plus a 3-week NFL Sunday Ticket free trialHigher headline promo amountCaesars (C2R)New "20 + 100% profit boosts""First Bet on Caesars"; up to $1,000 back in bonus bets if your first wager lostAdjustment lower in offer promoBetMGM (MGM)Up to $1,500 back in bonus bets if the first bet loses. Some states show Bet $10, win $150Similar first bet insurance up to $1,500 around Week 1 2024Largely unchangedbet365Bet $5, Get $200 in bonus bets (win or lose)Bet $5, Get $200UnchangedESPN BET (PENN)Bet $10, Get $100 in bonus bets + 30 days of ESPN+ and NFL weekly "Football Pot Builder" $10 bonus bet opt-in$1,000 First Bet Reset (lose + bonus bets)Lower $55 for new usersFanatics"Game Day Guarantee"; Up to $100 back in FanCash if your football bet loses on each game day$5M "Jersey Drop" activation + new-user $1,000 style bonuses and daily $100 payouts for 10 days in some statesOverall lower up-front but stronger ongoing promos.
Source: CBSsports.com, NY Post, legalsportsreport.com, Morgan Stanley Research

Heading into the start of the key NFL season, we review recent market trends, marketing and promotions across players. As a reminder, the period surrounding the start of NFL has been a consistent window of outperformance from OSB stocks (FLUT/DKNG \~450bps vs. the S&P 500 over the past 4 years and 2025 is on pace for \~500bps) but this has historically given way to underperformance in the subsequent month.

- Fanatics share grinding higher, even before recent ad campaign & Fancash push: Fanatics share on both handle and GGR basis has continued to grind higher from \~1% in Jan '24 to high single digits as of July (Exhibit 1 and Exhibit 2). The share improvement appears to largely be a function of a competitive tech/product offering relative to smaller competitors (i.e. C2R, ESPN Bet) as we have seen more minimal advertising and promotional spend other than in select pockets recently. With Fanatics now launching an online marketing/ad campaign and pushing new product improvements (we could see additional market share gains in the NFL season though we continue to see the most likely donors being tier 2 share holders (ie. BetMGM / C2R / ESPN Bet). ESPN Bet's FanCenter will be a key new product launch to watch as well – Fantasy Bet Builder + Integrated functionality with player insights are positive in our view – but more limited bandwidth for investment may
dampen uptake from customers already using market leaders, especially with incremental spend/competition from Fanatics.

- Deposits / Card data points to stable share by operator, deceleration in aggregate spend: Bloomberg's Second Measure data on card spend for sports books has decelerated from mid-teens to high single-digits in July, albeit on challenging comps. The trailing three months is still +10% yoy (comparable to overall industry handle growth) across the major operators with consistent share splits. Fanduel / Draftkings hold >85% of the share, and Fanatics is the #3 operator with ~5%, but this has been more consistent over time (vs. a step-up in the state data as discussed above).

- Reallocation of "generosity" (ads+promos) among leaders, overall environment still rationalizing: Advertising spend on linear TV has consistently come down the past three years for virtually every OSB operator. Promotional offers for the NFL (see Exhibit 6) are also largely consistent or even lower yoy on average. However, Draftkings & Fanduel appear to have slightly increased offers, signalling a reallocation of spend from ads to promotions. Fanatics is the one outlier, with a more aggressive promotional posture into the NFL at the same time they appear to be ramping online advertising campaigns with celebrity partners.

- QTD OSB hold tracking in-line with structural hold (~10.5%); Month 1 of NFL (September) will determine 3Q results. Industry results for OSB hold have been stable with July roughly in-line with structural hold (~10.5%) and August weekly results (ex-Fanatics in NY) are tracking around 10-11%. While NFL sport outcomes have been volatile for the past couple seasons, September will likely be the determining factor in how 3Q results play out (September ~47% of 3Q OSB handle since 2021).

- Prediction markets: On the back of FLUT's joint venture with the CME Group to create a prediction market business, we could see an announcement from DKNG and/or peers. The JV was said to focus on non-sports contracts first, but the announcement did occur just before the start of the NFL season. Perhaps the recent Travis Kelce / Taylor Swift proposal will blur the lines – ie. # of ppl at a Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce wedding or the # months before their first child is born after the wedding.
We have an email distribution over the weekend with additional details on the calendar of events, other themes, sentiment, and more... let us know if you want to be added.

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm.

For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal-weight, Not-Rated and Underweight. Overweight, Equal-weight, Not-Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy,hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal-weight and Not-Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
